dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAFFA, a Jamaican looking fellow in his early 20's, arriv at Water World, carrying a dusty cardboard box. There are a few workers milling about, setting up the par for opening. He passes EDDIE, a 25-something grounds work with Down's Syndrome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling, nodding) Jaffa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They do a hand slap maneuver that they have obviously wor out some time in the past. JAFFA proceeds up to the Custo Relations Kiosk, plops the box on the counter, and enters kiosk. We see him open the box, it is full of CD's. He pulls winter covers off of an overhead area to reveal player and amplifiers. He starts pushing buttons he's pus a thousand times, and lights come on. He pulls down a microphone, and clicks a button to see if it works. He reaches into the box of CDs and pulls one out. We see is Sheryl Crow. He gets the CD, examines it, and pops it into the CD player. He once again picks the microphone and flips the switch a pushes the "play" button on the CD player. His voice echoes through the park.         "Soak up the S playing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) Ladies and Gentlemen, Water World will be open in (checking his watch) twenty-six hours and forty-three minutes.

dialogues.speaker: EXT EARLY MORNING
dialogues.text: BIG MIKE, the park's owner/manager - a 50-something man w is portly and bald, and RICHARD THOMPSON, head lifeguard another GUARD are on the east side of Thunder Bay. There is a post with a box on top of it that has a winter cover on it. The GUARD is standing there with a garden ho holding it so the water goes into Thunder Bay. He is obviously tired, and has been standing there a long time. We look back at the massive size of the pool and ge the joke. BIG MIKE and RICHARD pull off the winter cover. The GUARD turns to look and the hose turns with him, getting BIG MI wet. They object and he turns back to filling Thunder Bay RICHARD moves the GUARD to a safe distance. BIG MIKE blows the dust off of the box at the top of the post, and we see it is a large push button. BIG MIKE look at RICHARD who nods "go ahead" and then pushes the button They both draw back as if something big should happen, bu nothing. They look at each other and BIG MIKE motions for RICHARD to go over to the wall housing the wave tank for pool. RICHARD waves OK, and BIG MIKE pushes the button again. W nothing happens, RICHARD whacks the side of the tank with closed fist. Suddenly a huge wave rolls out. Nodding his approval, BIG MIKE checks off an item in his clipboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see people working to open the park. The VAIL PRECISIO LAWN CHAIR DRILL TEAM dressed in Water World uniforms is setting and arranging chairs in time to the music. They perform precision maneuvers with the chairs, as if rifles and cross each other in a timed march to the music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BIG MIKE is standing under the Fun House structure with a clipboard. He is talking to RICHARD. After talking to BIG MIKE, RICHARD shakes his head affirmatively and walks off. He glances up to the two gua above, and grins. BIG MIKE is looking at his clipboard. W see quickly the large water tank above is spilling water bit, indicating it is full. The water tank spills over BIG MIKE drenching him. He sta there still, angry for a moment, then thinks better of it shaking his head and smiling, takes his pen and checks OK his wet clipboard for the fun house water tank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two guards are looking down at BIG MIKE below. One guard begins motioning as if guiding a crane into place. The ot guard has his hand poised on a large switch lever. GUARD ONE is gesturing more emphatically now, closing his hands to indicate "almost there". He closes his hands, an GUARD TWO pulls the lever. Page 3 of 81

dialogues.speaker: EXT. LATER THAT MORNING
dialogues.text: We are on the road to Water World in Federal Heights, Colorado. ROBBIE ZIRPOLLO is riding with his mother CONNI ZIRPOLLO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sardonically) Yeah. This is great. I love this plan. Drag me kicking and screaming from my happy home in California to some weird place in Colorado, and say hey, this'll be fun Robbie. Maybe we can go camping....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I know you're not happy about this. But it wasn't my idea for your father to have some kind of mid-life crisis and disappear with his secretary to Mexico with our life savings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Administrative Assistant." There's no such thing as a secretary anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. Administrative Assistant. We couldn't afford to sit around waiting any longer to see if he was coming back. I was able to land a good job here. And now thanks to Uncle Bernie you have this job at the Water Park...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking his head) Grounds crew. What kind of job is that? It sound like the guy who cleans out the coffee pots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie says you help keep the park clean, sweep up, that sort of thing. I'm sure it won't be so bad. Besides, a lot of the kids who work at this park go to the same high school you'll be going to. You can start the school year with some ready-made friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had friends in Oceanside. I had something to do for the summer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They pass the main Water World sign.    Hanging below it banner that says Opening Tomorrow!.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hanging out at the beach surfing with your friends is not my idea of something

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Page 4 of 81 to do. This way you'll make some money and meet people here. You'd best get used to it. This is where we live now. We're staying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All thanks to Dad and his secretary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Administrative Assistant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever.    Some summer....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They have arrived at the front gates of Water World, Kids are in a line leading to a check-in canopy kiosk that has sign saying Employee Check In.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Promise me you'll give it a try....please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (giving in to the inevitable) I will. I promise. See you later

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shuts the car door and walks over to the end of the li

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are about 40-50 teenagers in various default street clothes, shorts and tees mostly. Robbie takes his place i line behind an older, taller boy, ALEX, who seems to know almost everyone, and has made it his personal mission to greet them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (back still to ROBBIE) ...and so SHE says I'll have the filet AND the lobster". I had to borrow twenty bucks from Fitzgerald just to get out of the restaurant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two guys in front of Alex are laughing now.     Further d line however, another voice pops up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (waving to ALEX) By the way. Where is that twenty bucks?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (avoiding) Ohhh, hey Dougie. I'll catch up with you later... (turning around to ROBBIE as not to continue the conversation) Hey, how you doin'? Haven't seen you before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Page 5 of 81 ALEX looks in his wallet, as do we.    It is empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding) I'm Robbie. Robbie Zirpollo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Alex.     Where you workin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe it's with the Grounds Crew?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter, can't swim?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised) I can swim. Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you look old enough to be a guard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almost 16.     I get my license in September.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just that most of the guys on grounds are a little younger than you. Most guys your age that can swim are guards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I just moved here. I guess I missed guard tryouts. You're a guard then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no no no. I work concessions...at Aokee's Surf and Snack Shack. It's just as well. The guards are mostly stuck up anyway. The rest of us are the ones who know how to have fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't swim, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) Nope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (listening to speaker on post above) What is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mimicking his perception of surfers) Surf tunes, dude!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Page 6 of 81 (back to his own voice) You'll get used to it. You'll get to where you miss it. I had to buy two CD's just to get through the winter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are now at the front of the line. A teenage girl MELISSA is sitting at the table with papers and a clipboa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gesturing) Ahh. And here we have the fair Melissa, time clerk extraordinaire...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking her head no) Oh, Alex. Am I going to have to put up with your crap for another entire summer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking upward toward the sky) Dear Melissa. There's nothing about our relationship that couldn't be fixed by us spending a few moments together in the pumphouse behind Thunder Bay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well from what I hear, it would be a BRIEF few moments.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wincing) Ouch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not missing a beat) My dear, you cut me to the quick. Check off my name and that of my amigo here, Mr. Robbie Zirpollo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (handing them cards) Fill out these emergency cards, and turn them in when you pick up your uniforms.... (pointing) over there. And Alex?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to ROBBIE) She wants me. (turning back to MELISSA) Yeeees?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finger pointing) This year, let's clock in only our OWN time card, shall we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Page 7 of 81 (head shaking, to ROBBIE, walking together) Some people have no sense of humor.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. MORNING
dialogues.text: ROBBIE and ALEX walk up to yet another line of about 4 or teens. At the front a teenage girl and a teenage guy are behind a counter and handing out uniforms based on a clipboard list. As ROBBIE and ALEX reach the back of the line, TIFFANY, a blond beauty and two other girls brush past them to the f of the line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taken aback, breathing in through his nose) Whoa....who was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (unimpressed, putting his hand on ROBBIE's shoulder as if to hold him back, like a horse that is riled up) Eeeaasy there, big fella. Not in your lifetime. (wistfully, glancing over) Or mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So who is she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Tiffany Maxwell, daughter of Big Mike Maxwell, owner and operator of this here fine water park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE SEE TIFFANY and her two friends are quickly given thei uniforms by the attendants, as they ignore the kids who h waited in line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, Princess Tiffany and her friends pretty much have the run of the park. Her boyfriend is Dan Peterson, a guy we all call Cowboy, one of the lifeguards. Pretty decent guy from what I can tell. But she's a piece of work. Your best strategy is to steer clear of her and she won't cause you any trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cowboy, huh. Big guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big. Guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (takes in a deep breath)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Page 8 of 81 Hmm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are now at the front of the line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Alex. (calling back to FEMALE UNIFORM PERSON) Aokee's. Large. (to ROBBIE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Female Uniform Person has brought a blue Hawaiian shirt o hanger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rob Zirpollo. Uh, Robert Zirpollo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks on clipboard) Grounds? (looks at FEMALE UNIFORM PERSON)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (and FEMALE UNIFORM PERSON, together, ominously) Grounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She disappears to the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to ALEX) So what is this grounds thing, anyway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's just say....you are critical and indispensable to the ongoing operation... and....flow of things here at the park. (he and MALE UNIFORM GUY exchange a knowing glance)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here you go, tiger. One grounds. Medium. You have a pair of green shorts at home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROBBIE shakes his head "no".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buy some. Tonight. Wear them tomorrow along with this shirt. You need to report to the area just south of Surf's Up. Look for a guy wearing Army pants and glasses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll show him. I'm going in that

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Page 9 of 81 direction. (to ROBBIE with feigned excitement) You get to meet The Colonel!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk off.   As they walk off we can hear ALEX in the distance...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (marching) Left. Left. Left right left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 9       EXT. MORNING - MOMENTS LATER - AOKEE'S SURF & Aokee's is a restaurant near Thunder Bay. It seats about and is lavishly decorated in a Hawaiian Surf and Ocean mo with surf memorabilia, fish nets, surfboards, and the lik AOKEE is a large 375 pound plus apparently Hawaiian man, twenties, early thirties, wearing a purple Hawaiian shirt blue shorts and a white chef's apron that says KISS THE C WE SEE him on a pay phone behind the counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to person on the line) David...how you do this to me? I have full staff with you. I save your spot. I was counting on you. (listens, nods) Yes, yes....but The Gap? What you think you do there? Are there girls in swimming suits? Have you forgotten? (listens, shaking head) Tips. Do you get tips? Cash money? (listens some more)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALEX walks up.   AOKEE waves to him.   He is obviously up

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (resigned) Well, come see us this summer, eh? You're a good kid...a good worker.     Yeah, you too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AOKEE hangs up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David. Seems to think there is future in retail. Now what I do? I'm one person short. Park opens tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AOKEE buries his head in his hands on the counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinking) You know...I just met a guy that's old

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Page 10 of 81 enough to work here, but he's stuck in grounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (perking up) Good guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seemed like our kind of people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AOKEE thinks for a moment. He glances up towards Surf's U It hits both he and ALEX at the same time...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need to get him before he get his plunger!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They take off running.

dialogues.speaker: UP
dialogues.text: AOKEE and ALEX are running together. They get about 50 fe before AOKEE, large man that he is, runs out of breath. ALEX, like a boxer in training, sort of runs in place, keeping loose, ready for AOKEE to catch his wind. Off the go again, get another 50 feet, and the same thing happens

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (out of breath) Alex...... (wheeze) ..you got to go ahead... (wheeze) ...stall 'til I get there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding, running in place) OK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALEX takes off, and AOKEE runs again....

dialogues.speaker: EXT. MORNING
dialogues.text: WE SEE several rolling trash cans lined up in a row, alon with several janitorial carts filled with cleaning utensi and supplies. THE COLONEL is standing, dressed in army fatigue pants an Water World golf shirt, with a green Water World baseball cap. He is wearing black horn-rim glasses, thick lenses, carrying a clipboard. Lined up as if an army unit are ten grounds kids, includi ROBBIE, who is sixth furthest from THE COLONEL. They are younger than ROBBIE except one, EDDIE, whom we met at the beginning of the film. EDDIE is standing tall and straight, proud to be there. is nearest THE COLONEL Page 11 of 81

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking up from clipboard) Well, it looks like we have a good staff here. Yes...yes a good staff. It will be an excellent summer. Remember as we go through training today, our park is judged by the work WE do. If we do it well, the people come back. (walking up and down the line) We have a little tradition here on the grounds crew. Rather than having to learn a lot of names, many of which I can never hope to pronounce properly, each grounds crew member gets a grounds crew nickname. You will be known by that nickname in every way except, of course, your paycheck and employee records.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE COLONEL looks over his paperwork.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's see, what do we    have? Hmm...yes. OK, first up is Eddie    Cochran. Your grounds crew nickname    will be.....Eddie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EDDIE smiles knowingly. This has been his grounds crew nickname for the last 8 years, mostly because he would ne answer to anything else, and THE COLONEL gave up trying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now crewmembers, listen up. Eddie here has eight years experience on the grounds crew. Why, I'd like to think there isn't anything, any situation that Eddie hasn't faced. Listen to him. Learn from him. Watch what he does. This man is the finest, most conscientious grounds crewman we've ever had.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EDDIE is beaming with pride now. THE COLONEL pulls a bran new toilet plunger from the cart nearby and hands it to EDDIE. EDDIE shoulders it as if it were a rifle. THE COLONEL walks down the line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's see...Clark? Hmmm. Your grounds crew nickname will be....Sparky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is all ROBBIE can do not to laugh. THE COLONEL goes on the next kid, SKEETER who is tall, skinny and goofy-looki SKEETER'S eyes are faced forward, but something catches t His eyes follow an unseen object as we begin to hear a sm mosquito. Finally his eyes follow it until he looks, cros eyed at his own nose. THE COLONEL has taken note of this and is following it to SKEETER can take no more, and brushes it off his nose as makes a face. Page 12 of 81

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, sir. Mosquito.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmmm.....your grounds crew nickname will be.....Skeeter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE COLONEL steps over the cart and gets another new plun and hands it to SKEETER who follows EDDIE's lead. Next in line is a short, chubby lad, SNITCH. As THE COLON approaches him, a quick sound of passing gas is heard. THE COLONEL is startled, and SNITCH makes a quick finger motion indicating the culprit is SKEETER, next to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at the clipboard) Bradley, is it? OK, Mr. Bradley.....your grounds crew nickname will be Snitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SNITCH shows his dismay with a frown. THE COLONEL has run out of new plungers already and is forced to move to one last year's leftovers, which look somewhat depressing. He gets one and give it to SNITCH, who looks at it, makes face, and decides not to shoulder it. ROBBIE is so depres he looks like he's about to pass out. His worst fears have been realized.    His summer is pass before his eyes. There's only one more person, a young 14 year-old girl, t before ROBBIE. THE COLONEL addresses her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melinda Tally. Hmmm... your grounds crew nickname will be... (thinking)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly ALEX bursts onto the scene, and even he, at this point, is somewhat out of breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Colonel!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinking, staring) Alex, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes sir, Colonel. And what a fine staff you've assembled this year. Have you told them yet about your army background?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, no, I didn't think it was..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Page 13 of 81 (interrupting, to the grounds kids) The Colonel here is very modest. Did you know that he reorganized the entire process of cleaning and sanitizing an army barracks and its latrines?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it really wasn't much of a...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting again) Wasn't much? (again, to grounds kids) Can you just imagine for a moment the germs and bacteria our American soldiers could pick up in an unsanitised army latrine? It's impossible to determine just how many lives have been saved thanks to the efforts of this one humble Army Colonel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I suppose when you put it that way...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the grounds kids) I, too, came up through the ranks when at age 14, I began my service here at Water World learning from this great man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes....I remember now.....what was your grounds nickname...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not even sure I remember it myself, sir. But I remember much more. Did you tell them about the film?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Film?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to THE COLONEL) "Hygiene Makes You Happy" (to the grounds kids) Every enlisted man in the army has seen it. Some by choice. All from the mind of The Colonel here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself) I never forget a grounds nickname....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AOKEE has finally made it now, but is, of course, out of breath again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Page 14 of 81 (concerned) Aokee, good God, man...are you OK?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AOKEE gestures he is fine, and does a combination of char and Hawaiian pantomime before he finally speaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colonel....terrible mistake...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALEX gets behind AOKEE, deciding he needs some help, feed him words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly behind AOKEE) Bureaucratic bumble...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bureaucratic bumble....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lost paperwork....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lost paperwork....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An error in the front office...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Error in front office....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spiced applesauce....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spiced...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AOKEE stops, turn and glares at ALEX, who merely smiles a shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good God, man, what are you trying to say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALEX comes around from behind AOKEE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Robbie sir. He was supposed to work at Aokee's and through some crazy mix-up, he ended up here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at clipboard) Zirpollo? Well this is highly irregular...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is flipping though the papers, confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (can't pass this up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Page 15 of 81 Most annoying....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Most annoying....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never happened before....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never happened before....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spaghetti marinara...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spa....what? (exasperated) Well, if he was supposed to be assigned to you, we'll just have to let him go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROBBIE has caught on and is quick to step out of line, an pick up his shirt to be ready to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to THE COLONEL) I was confused myself, sir. I had heard I was working for some Hawaiian guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reassuring) I promise, we go straight to personnel, straighten the whole thing out. You won't need to worry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very well.     We'll just have to make-do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE COLONEL goes back to the girl MELINDA he was about to nickname before the interruption, but is staring after AL AOKEE and ROBBIE as they walk off. He looks at MELINDA. H looks back at ALEX & company. It hits him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (remembering) Snafu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His grounds crew nickname.     I remember it now. Snafu.

dialogues.speaker: EXT -DAY
dialogues.text: The entire staff of Water World is assembled for a pre opening pep talk from owner BIG MIKE MAXWELL. He wears a Water World Golf shirt, shorts and a crew-style marine ha Standing next to him is RICHARD THOMPSON, head lifeguard. The workers are sitting on the hill. Page 16 of 81 AOKEE, THE COLONEL and other "management" types are stand off to the side. TIFFANY and her friends are sitting up front. ALEX and ROBBIE are sitting together towards the back, an ROBBIE's grounds t-shirt is no longer in his hand, but ha been replaced by a folded AOKEE'S blue Hawaiian shirt. There is a lot of noise from everyone talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (motioning to get everyone to settle down) Okay, everybody, let's quiet down for a minute. (they do, and he looks down at his clipboard) For those who don't know me, my name is Michael Maxwell, and I...sort of run things around here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A chant starts up, with affection...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big Mike! Big Mike! Big Mike!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BIG MIKE smiles, this has happened before, probably a tradition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (again motioning to settle down) Okay, yeah thanks. Now, I want go over a few basic things. First of all, make sure you've all filled out your paperwork with personnel, cause nobody gets paid unless they do. Come to think of it, I suppose it's better for me that you don't fill out your paperwork, then I don't have to pay you. I'll make it optional. If you want to get paid, fill out your paperwork. (looking at clipboard) Let's remember, the people who come here are our guests, and your job is to see they have a safe and fun experience here. Let's work together to keep the park clean and safe, and we'll have a great summer together. Now with a few words is our head lifeguard, Richard Thompson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another cheer starts up, smaller this time, which ALEX starts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big Dick! Big Dick Big Dick!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wincing some, but not

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Page 17 of 81 surprised, motioning to settle down) Yeah, yeah, very funny, we're all very amused. Okay, many of you have been in training for some time, and some of you still have a ways to go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE SEE a quick shot of some geeky younger guards wearing water wings, sharky goggles and noseplugs and looking les than confident...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (glancing at the water wing group wistfully, almost to himself) ...a long ways to go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks down at his clipboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...but I'd like to take a moment to speak, mostly to the guards, but certainly everyone has a role in this. We can take everything we've learned and distill it down to two simple rules. Rule number one:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pauses, thoughtful for a moment, but building into a n rage for effect to impress on everyone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (loudly, emphatically, angry at the thought that anybody might...) Don't drown!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stops, composing himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (almost quietly) Rule number two:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again, thoughtful but building to a rage at the thought t this could happen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (loudly, emphatically) Don't let anyone else drown!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stops again, and regains his composure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (almost quietly to the stunned crowd) Thank you. Have a great summer!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is stunned silence for a moment.    They're not sur to react.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Page 18 of 81 (breaking the silence) Alright! Whoo whoo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALEX, then everyone begins applauding. ROBBIE looks at AL quizzically, ALEX just shrugs. The meeting breaks up. 13        INT - MORNING - THE NEXT DAY - AOKEE'S SURF &am Everyone is hurrying around, getting ready for opening da ROBBIE, wearing his new blue Hawaiian shirt, is cutting pineapple. AOKEE is busy hovering over everyone, and cook chicken on the grill. ALEX walks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to ROBBIE) Hey, hey lookin' good. Blue is your color. Beats that stupid t-shirt, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (unhappy, stressed) Alex! You are late. Come on, is opening day!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROBBIE finishes the pineapple and hands the tray to AOKEE almost spilling it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to ROBBIE and ALEX) You two start setting tables.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALEX takes a pile of silverware wrapped in napkins, and points to ROBBIE to grab a box of sugar packets to refill dispensers. ROBBIE grabs it quickly, enthusiastically, bu loses his grip and spills the packets on the floor. At that moment, AUDREY a girl in her teens who works at AOKEE'S and is stacking plastic cups on the counter, accidentally knocks a stack of cups to the ground. RAMON, a teenage boy who works there is behind the counte He bends over, disappearing, and we hear a crash of pots pans. His head peers up from below the counter sheepishly AOKEE turns from the grill looking at all this, and has a worried look, but smiles and shrugs weakly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to ALEX, gesturing) Alex. Come here a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALEX comes up close next to him at the grill so they can talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with intensity) Alex, look. We falling apart. I made you assistant manager this year. Go assistant manage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Page 19 of 81 (agreeing) No problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALEX pops a CD out of the rack above the sound system, an puts it in the CD player, stopping the standard pastoral Hawaiian music that has been playing. He turns up the volume some on the amp, and goes over to SARAH, a teenage girl working there, and grabs her grass skirt by the Velcro, removing it with a Velcro rip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, Sarah, but I need to borrow this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised) Hey! How did you know I wear shorts under that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mock surprise, rolling his eyes) Oh, Puh-leeaase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALEX walks back out to the dining area, everyone is still working.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to all) Ladies and Gentlemen, may I have your attention, please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone stops and looks at ALEX.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In exactly 30 minutes, hundreds of dripping wet customers with fistfuls of money smelling of chlorine and suntan lotion will be walking in here. And what will they be looking for? (as if directing a choir)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (except ROBBIE, who doesn't know any better) The best teriyaki east of the pacific!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annnnnnd?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Again except ROBBIE, who doesn't know any better) The finest smoothies in the state!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, everyone's a little tense, except me, of course. So to help you get in the proper frame of mind and relax, we need

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Page 20 of 81 the right soundtrack. (to AOKEE) Maestro?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AOKEE hits the play button on the CD player.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is little tune I like to call the Paradise Slide. (mouthing with the song as it starts) One, two, a one two three.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The music starts and ALEX, now wearing SARAH's grass skir launches into his version of the electric slide, Hawaiian style. EVERYONE ELSE gets the beat and begins working to the mus AOKEE is using his spatulas as drum sticks on the overhan kitchen tools. RAMON has inverted an empty pot and is beating it conga-d style. ROBBIE has picked up the sugar packets and ALEX is dancin and quickly (almost casually) tossing silverware/napkin r to ROBBIE as ROBBIE catches them (at first with some difficulty) and puts them on the tables. SARAH has re-stacked the cups, and is juggling salt & shakers, placing them on the tables. AUDREY chops onions the beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the chorus) Don Ho, Don Ho, Don Ho. Don Ho, Don Ho, Don Ho.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AOKEE has now taken all the chicken off the grill and com out from behind the counter, dancing. The others form a CONGA LINE behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the chorus) Don Ho, Don Ho, Don Ho. Don Ho, Don Ho, Don Ho.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they go by the tables they put on any missing items. T get into it more and more, AOKEE especially, swinging his huge, 375 pound guy hips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the chorus) Don Ho, Don Ho, Don Ho. Don Ho, Don Ho, Don Ho.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the song ends (abruptly), AOKEE bumps a surfboard (par the restaurant's decoration) with his hip, knocking it an another one to the ground. Page 21 of 81 There is a loud crash and everyone pauses and looks at AO waiting to see if he gets mad. AOKEE looks down at his hip, and makes a puppy-dog face l "I didn't know my hips were that big...." Everyone claps, laughing. AOKEE takes a bow. 14        INT -LATER THAT DAY - AOKEE'S SURF & SNACK ROBBIE and ALEX are carrying bus tubs loaded with dirty dishes back toward the kitchen from the dining area. AOKEE is sipping on a smoothie and leaning back on a coun There are only a few customers in the eating area. They set the tubs down on a counter that passes to the ba area. An unseen person takes them into the dishwashing ar

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to ALEX and ROBBIE) You did good work today. Here. I made you some of my special Power Smoothies. More customers later wanting dinner before park closes. I can't have you falling asleep on me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to ALEX) Alex, we are completely out of table stretchers and left-handed coffee pots. Take Robbie and go find some. I think some at the first-aid station near Surf's Up pool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding knowingly) Right. See you in a little while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk off carrying their smoothies.

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: ROBBIE and ALEX are walking past Thunder Bay concessions toward THE WAVE carrying and drinking their smoothies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So that was a typical lunch crowd?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's early in the season yet. We'll get busier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (incredulous) Busier?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing) Don't worry. You'll get used to it.      And tips were good, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Page 22 of 81

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothing like cash money in your pocket. What's that over there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are coming up on THE WAVE area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you'll find this ride interesting.

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: The walk up to THE WAVE attraction, where kids are surfin a high-water pressure river/ sheet of water. Surf music plays loudly here, and kids are doing all kinds of tricks Some riders are good, some are not, and fall quickly. We also see SKEETER and SNITCH, the tall skinny and short chubby grounds kids we met earlier. They are cleaning up around the exit area of THE WAVE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as a rider falls) It's a lot harder than it looks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't imagine it's that difficult. (to himself) ...no rudder on the board...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now this is a place of many wonders.     See those guys in line over there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE SEE some guys that look a little stoned with unusual h laughing and talking to each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We call them "Wave Bums". They all have season passes, and do little more than ride the wave all day long. Some of them get pretty good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex points up to a fence, behind which some smoke appear be drifting up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's where they hang out when they're not riding the wave. Don't get too close to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sniffing) Contact high.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROBBIE nods, understanding. ALEX points back to THE WAVE. Page 23 of 81

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And there, my friend, is another one of The Wave's features.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE SEE a pretty girl in line to ride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We call them "Wave Babes". And there's a special secret to this ride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With that ALEX walks over to BOB, a guy in his late teens wearing a Security Golf Shirt. He is standing and looking off in a different direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Bob....can I borrow your radio a minute?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands him the radio, and ALEX is back with ROBBIE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into radio) Hey Frank, it's Alex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALEX waves and FRANK, the guard watching THE WAVE waves b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (heard through the radio) Yo, Alex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into radio) Listen you have a possible code 4. (to ROBBIE) Means a "hottie".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to radio) She's up next. A free chicken sandwich and a smoothie if you bounce up the pressure a bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (heard through radio) You got it bud. But two smoothies. "Volcanos".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to ROBBIE) He knows my weak spot. (to radio) Two Volcanos and a chicken sandwich.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (heard through radio) Time to go to ludicrous speed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Page 24 of 81 WE SEE FRANK push forward on a handle next to him that se to resemble the throttle on a speedboat. The ambient nois from the wave is noticeably higher. The WAVE BABE jumps into the water with the board.      S and SNITCH are still cleaning near the exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to ROBBIE, still holding the radio) Watch, and wait....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THEY LOOK intently at the WAVE BABE, who is pretty good, with the increased water flow. But, after a few deft move she falls. ALEX looks, and sees what he is looking for. ROBBIE smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yesss!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We look back at the WAVE BABE, but the water is obscuring view. We then see a medium shot of SKEETER and SNITCH. Th WAVE BABE walks past them carrying a board, but we don't below her waist, the board obscures our view. SNITCH sees, and freezes, dumbstruck. SKEETER is looking down at the grate where THE WAVE water drains. He reaches down and pulls something out, and turns to the WAVE BABE walking away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (unaffected) Excuse me... Miss? (louder) Hello...excuse me...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally she turns. We see her, but just a flash of her fr the back, as the board covers her waist area. She is puzz by this grounds kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding up the bottom to her swimsuit) Is this yours?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks down behind the board and reacts.     She bites lower lip, winces and nods yes. SKEETER hands her her swimsuit, and she looks around and backs away towards a towel hanging from the fence nearby. SNITCH is still frozen, stunned by what he's just seen, m wide open. SKEETER waves his hand in front of SNITCH's fa No reaction.   He's never seen a naked girl before. We're back to ALEX and ROBBIE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at ALEX) You were right. I was interested in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Page 25 of 81 this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, sometime bring your swimsuit. We'll come back on break. I'll show you how to do it. Surf's is this way. And keep an eye out for Frank over there. We owe him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROBBIE nods in agreement, and they walk off.

dialogues.text: ROBBIE and ALEX are walking past the SURF'S UP wave pool.

dialogues.text: (pointing) The First Aid station is over there. Just ask the guard. I just want to say hello to this girl I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK.

dialogues.text: ROBBIE walks over to the First Aid Station. DOUG FITZGERA the guy we heard in line on the first day is there, he's guard.

dialogues.text: Hey. I've been sent to find some table stretchers and left-handed coffee pots.

dialogues.text: Oh, you must be the new guy at Aokee's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jama...I mean...Jaffa the Jamaican...what shakes, it mon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jus' the same old this's and that's, mon.

dialogues.text: Jaffa, meet Robbie Zirpollo. (to ROBBIE) Jaffa plays the tunes and talks the talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) What? No way. (hangs up phone, to ALEX & ROBBIE) Check it out...

dialogues.text: JAFFA smiles and picks up a radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into radio) Attention Lost River guards. We have a report that some huge fat bald guy has abandoned his swimsuit and is slidin' down Lost River with nothin' on but a smile. Be watchin' for a great white whale now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on PA system now, into mike) Attention please. Will Mr. John Big Bootay report to Lost River Splashdown. John Big-Bootay to Lost River Splashdown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to ROBBIE) He's calling for security.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALEX wanders off a moment, looking at something going on the distance. Page 27 of 81

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to JAFFA) Wow. Jamaica. I thought I was far from home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dropping the accent a bit) I'll let you in on a little secret. Perception is everything...now, Jamal from Aurora, he's probably over with those guys...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE SEE SKEETER and SNITCH walking into the men's room, looking suspiciously around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (back to the accent) ...cleaning the rest rooms. But Jaffa from Jamaica, he's in customer service, wearin' the nice shirt and playing the music. Perception and atmosphere. You get it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROBBIE smiles and nods, and waves goodbye to catch up wit ALEX.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: SNITCH is filling up a water balloon, while SKEETER is ty a piece of fishing line to the hook on the inside of the stall door. SKEETER climbs up on top of the stall. SNITCH is tying off the water balloon and grabs the other of the fishing line, and ties it to the fill end of the balloon. He shuts the stall door, tosses the balloon up t SKEETER, who places it strategically on the beam above th toilet. SKEETER then jumps down, and they head for the do Eddie Enters. dialogues.text: EDDIE is now pushing his cart and making his way toward t MEN's RESTROOM. He stops to talk to two concessions girls and show them a magic trick that apparently involves a de of cards, which he pulls from a place on his cart. We see him holding the cards so one girl can pick one.

dialogues.text: SKEETER pops his head out and looks around. He sees Eddie the distance about 5 minutes away, and putting a plastic liner in a trash can. He nods and disappears into the men room. dialogues.text: Hey Eddie.     What have you got?

dialogues.text: Two young women guards, KATIE and AMY are loading kids in tubes and pushing them onto the slide. AMY is a little ol than KATIE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...so then he just disappeared.      I had to call my Dad to come pick me up.

dialogues.text: Page 29 of 81 KATIE just shakes her head in amazement. ROBBIE and ALEX walk up to them. AMY is out of earshot, loading a kid. ALEX hangs back a bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to KATIE) Hi. We're looking for some table stretchers and left-handed coffee pots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Amy, this guy is looking for a table stretcher?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (coming over) Aokee's huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised) Uh, yes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to ROBBIE, seeing ALEX in the background) They're all down at Big Mike's last I saw. (to ALEX) When you gonna tell him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Amy.   Who's this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katie, this is Alex and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taken with KATIE) Robbie. Ummm, Rob Zirpollo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, anyway, Big Mike's is where they are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALEX and ROBBIE walk off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a couple of losers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know...I thought Robbie was kind of cute...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, you're new, so let me tell you how things are. First those guys were wearing blue shorts. That means

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Page 30 of 81 concessions. (uses her fingers to explain) The Water World social structure is organized on three levels. At the bottom are the Trash Rats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trash rats?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bottom feeders. Grounds kids. Babies. They clean the toilets and empty the trash. Most are only 14 years old. It's the only job younger kids can do here. Next up is concessions. They're our "middle class". We don't hang with them and they don't much hang with us. At the top of heap are the guards. You are a guard. Girl, if you want to go out with someone, stick with your own kind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking off at ROBBIE and ALEX walking away) Aw, that's just silly. I think he's cute.

dialogues.speaker: EXT -DAY BOTTOM OF RIVER COUNTRY ON THE WAY T
dialogues.text: This in an area where riders splash down from riding a tu down the River Country slides. ROBBIE and ALEX are walkin past the splashdown area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did that girl Amy mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When she said, when are you going to tell him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell you over a hamburger at Big Mike's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROBBIE and ALEX proceed to BIG MIKE's out of frame. SUDDENLY in the background we see a tube splashdown from slide and the 7 year-old girl riding in it falls out. Realizing she is no longer safely in a tube she screams a begins splashing as if drowning. A guard nearby blows a single tweet of her whistle. IN SLOW MOTION we see four other guards throughout the ar turn and react to the whistle. They begin running, BAYWAT style towards the scene. Page 31 of 81 Two guards are running and carrying a backboard. They converge in another BAYWATCH style slow-mo shot and line along the edge of the splashdown pool. One guard in the middle has a rescue tube, and, still in motion, squats down slowly as if to jump in and rescue th girl. At the low end of the jump crouch, however he stops. his face in close-up as he says.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slow-motion, voice distorted, to the girl) Staaaannnd Uuuuuuuupppp!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The drowning girl stops splashing wildly, and realizes sh can indeed stand up. She looks at all the guards lined up smiles sheepishly, and walks out of the pool.

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: ALEX is standing outside of BIG MIKE's.    ROBBIE is walk out of the restaurant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Shaking his head) Aokee's not going to be happy. Nobody seems to know where these things are...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) Yep. (now laughing)

dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no such thing as a table stretcher or a left-handed coffee pot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a dirty trick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) It's just Aokee's way of giving you a tour of the park without having to be there. Consider it a rookie initiation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still mad) Humph.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time to make it up to you.    Come on.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. DAY
dialogues.text: Page 32 of 81 ALEX knocks loudly on the door. A teenage boy, DAVE in a BIG MIKE's uniform answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Davey...how 'bout two for two?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malts?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks at ROBBIE) Chocolate. (ROBBIE nods)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVE disappears for moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, if he ever shows up at our back door, we owe him chicken and smoothies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But...don't we get an employee discount? Shouldn't we go in the front?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...the discount is larger this way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROBBIE is getting out money from his pocket, counting thr it. DAVE shows up with two burgers and two malts, and hands t to ALEX, disappears and shuts the door quickly. ROBBIE is still staring at his money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on...let's go eat!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk out of frame.

dialogues.speaker: INT -DAY AOKEE'S SURF AND SNACK SHACK
dialogues.text: ALEX and ROBBIE are cleaning tables after another busy lu WE SEE that AOKEE is filling up a bucket, and getting a s brush, and heads out the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh boy.   Here we go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aokee. The pigeons have been taking target practice on his trophy pedestal. Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They exit out the same doorway as AOKEE. Page 33 of 81

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: AOKEE is busily cleaning and cursing the pigeons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (speaking Hawaiian) Stupid Pigeons. They should all die!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to ROBBIE) Happens every week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to AOKEE) What is this thing for anyway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someday, Robbie.   Someday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He keeps cleaning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to ROBBIE) That stand is to display the coveted Surfer King trophy. Aokee seems to think that one day some concessions kid with more courage than brains is going to beat the lifeguards in the annual Employee Olympics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what would this concessions kid have to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing, really. Just out surf the strongest guard of them all in the surfing competition. No big deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Has it ever happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A guard always wins the surf competition. Know why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ROBBIE and ALEX) Because concessions kids can't swim!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still cleaning) Someday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They go back into AOKEE'S SURF AND SNACK SHACK.

dialogues.speaker: INT MOMENTS LATER -DAY- AOKEE'S SURF AND SNACK
dialogues.text: ROBBIE is now behind the counter making smoothies.      H Page 34 of 81 them up and the two kids waiting take them and walk away. In walk AMY and KATIE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to ROBBIE) Hi there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (blinking, smiling) Hello. On break?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.   Two Blue Crushes please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coming up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shakes a mix container, blends it for about 5 seconds pours it out into two cups. He then puts in two umbrellas with pineapple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oooh. Umbrellas.       I've never gotten umbrellas before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These are only for VIP guests.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AMY looks over to KATIE and rolls her eyes. ALEX arrives at this point, and decides to provide a distraction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy. Have you ever seen the fabulous Cummings and Robbins 2000-B?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking her head) I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he leads her back into the kitchen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's incredible.      It washes 2000 plates an hour....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to ROBBIE) So... you're not from around here, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: California. I just moved here at the beginning of the summer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll bet California's nice.      I've never been west of the mountains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Page 35 of 81

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd love the ocean. And the sunsets are incredible. You can almost hear the sizzle as the sun drops into the ocean... (daydreaming a bit) Of course, we all know it doesn't drop into the ocean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. (pause) I'm surprised you're not a guard, coming from the ocean and all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's just say I missed my chance, and Alex saved me from a death worse than fate. I was very nearly a trash rat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frowns) Oh. Good save.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALEX has distracted AMY all he could and they return from kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well. That was exciting. Maybe next time you can show me how to scrub the grill. Come on, Katie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to ROBBIE, interested) Well...how'd you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinking) Mmmm. I told her how beautiful the California sunsets are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good job. You work fast. Hey it's time for our break. Bring your swimsuit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.   The Wave?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wave.    I love that water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROBBIE looks confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't swim. It's only three inches deep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grabbing his suit and a towel) Ah ha! Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Page 36 of 81

dialogues.speaker: EXT -MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: ROBBIE and ALEX have their swimsuits on, and are in line get on THE WAVE. ALEX is coaching ROBBIE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, just take it easy, and don't expect too much at first. When you wipe out, your ride is done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALEX is up now, and he grabs the board and jumps in. He i pretty good, but not nearly as good as the WAVE BUMS. He does a few tricks and wipes out. He gets up and walks up the line to watch ROBBIE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting) Just ease into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROBBIE takes the board and looks around. He jumps full fo onto the wave. It takes him just a moment to get the feel the board, and then he is all over it, making the WAVE BU look like rookies. Spins, rolls, everything that can be d he does. Finally, the guard blows a whistle indicating th his time is up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (meeting him at the exit) Gees. Where did you learn to do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm from Oceanside, California.    I was born on a surfboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They start walking back. They stop for a moment to look at Thunder Bay. Just then wave spews out, and kids on tubes are screaming as they always do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think you could ride that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking right into ALEX's eyes) In my sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALEX just smiles. 32        INT - LATER THAT DAY - AOKEE'S SURF & SNACK AOKEE is cleaning up behind the counter.    ALEX is grinn like the cat that ate the canary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you so happy about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Page 37 of 81 (shaking his head) You're not gonna believe it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen. Some guy came in today and try to buy a sandwich and pay with a phone card. Today I believe anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I took Robbie to The Wave today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking around) What? He drown?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It turns out that he's from Oceanside. California. You know, where they always hold those surf competitions?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.   So?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It turns out that he placed second in the state high school finals for the shortboard competition. As a Sophomore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robbie. (laughing in disbelief, dismissive, then serious) Robbie barely walk without help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw it myself.      You wouldn't believe it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear a loud CRASH from the kitchen.      AOKEE winces gestures toward the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don' believe it.      Our Robbie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our Robbie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinking) If this true....this could be da year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I was thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, go get him. We need to make ready. He not just walk in and win this thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You heard it. He's in the kitchen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Page 38 of 81 ALEX goes into the back. AOKEE sits at a table. Robbie comes out of the kitchen wearing a dishwasher apron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robbie, sit down. Alex, make up a Volcano. This boy in training.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sitting down, worried) What did I spill now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE HEAR the whine of a blender as ALEX is working on the Volcano Smoothie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robbie, Alex tell me you are some kind of surfer. This true?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I dunno. Yeah, surfing is usually how I spend my summers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know about Employee Olympics?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.   Some kind of trophy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surfer King trophy. Very big.     Very nice. (looking down) Concessions never win.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALEX arrives with the Volcano Smoothie. He turns a chair around and sits. They will gang up on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I dunno...seems kind of silly to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a big deal. Every girl     wants to date you. Every guy wants to BE      you. Special privileges...we all     wear standard uniforms.   The Surfer King     gets to be creative. You ever see the      cowboy hat Cowboy wears?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It shouldn't be that hard...how good could this Cowboy be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He very good. His family go to Hawaii every year, two, three weeks. Good surfer. If you do this, you need to see Pipeman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Page 39 of 81 Pipeman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a myth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no. Pipeman very real. Works here in park. Low profile. You must find him and convince him to teach you the secrets of the Thunder Bay wave. This not the ocean, surf boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinking) Pipeman. The Banzai Pipeline. I get it. Some kind of legendary surf champ. Where do we find him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I only see him once, maybe twice. Stay behind scenes. But here he is and find him you must. (to ROBBIE) So. You do this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robbie looks at them, thinking for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 33        INT -MOMENTS LATER - AOKEE'S SURF & SNACK S WE SEE quarters going ding ding ding into the pay phone o AOKEE'S wall. The shot widens to reveal AOKEE is dumping quarters and ROBBIE is holding the phone. He puts it up t his ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Hello, Grandma? No, I'm fine. Listen, Grandma...I need you to send me a few of my things...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AOKEE and ALEX are huddled around smiling.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: BIG MIKE is standing, walking around as he speaks, TIFFAN sitting. Clearly she is being scolded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (angry) ....why you wouldn't believe the things I've heard. Just stupid things. Cutting in line. Demanding special treatment. Oh, and how about this one: (mimicking her) Princesses don't carry trash. (back to his voice) I've often thought it was a mistake to have you work here. Maybe I was right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Page 40 of 81

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to dance out of it) Oh, daddy. You know how jealous people get.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd almost believe that. But I was behind the First Aid station when you said the "princess" line. This park exists because the kids here work hard. They need to be treated fairly. They need to see you are just another lifeguard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (protesting) But I'm not just another lifeguard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mad again) You won't even be that if this continues. If you want to keep coming here every day and driving that little convertible of yours, I need to see real, concrete changes in your attitude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right.     What do you expect me to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For one thing, start mingling with "the commoners". You'd be amazed at how nice some of the people who work here are. Make some friends outside that little group of yours. It's the work of the average teenager here that puts food on our table. Show some gratitude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinking a moment) Fine. I'll work it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softening, but firm) Good. Work on it. Please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding, but we don't believe her) Oh, Daddy. Don't worry about a thing.

dialogues.speaker: EXT MORNING
dialogues.text: ROBBIE and ALEX hook up and grab their time cards. There a banner hanging that says, "Employee Luau Tonight", and SKEETER and SNITCH have taken a 5 gallon bucket and are u it as a stepladder to attach something. SKEETER is on the bucket with a stapler in his hand. SNIT hands up the hand-lettered magic marker addition, which Page 41 of 81 SKEETER staples on to the bottom of the banner while SNIT keeps a lookout. The addition says, "COME GET LEI'D".     They scamper off laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking up at the sign) This will be good. Aokee throws a great Luau.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't how much fun it will be.     With Aokee hosting, we'll be working.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There'll still be time for fun. Most of the work is setting up. Besides, we get paid, too. When was the last time you got paid to party?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With that, ALEX punches in, as if to punctuate the line. 36        EXT - NIGHT -   OUTSIDE AOKEE'S SURF & SNAC It is dark, but the place is lit up by little lights everywhere, Christmas lights in the fake palm trees, TIKI lights around AOKEE's, and lights lighting a stage where band is playing, what else, surf music. Buffet tables line the area, and there is SMOOTHIE BAR se up. BIG MIKE himself is behind the bar making smoothies, while RICHARD is playing bass in the band. AOKEE is runni around making sure all the buffet items are full. Everyon is wearing Leis, but the cheap plastic ones, except AOKEE his staff, who have real ones flown in from Hawaii.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pouring out four smoothies to ROBBIE and ALEX) OK. You work hard, and we fine now. Your time to party. Here they are. Special Love Smoothies. Be careful!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to ROBBIE) These never fail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALEX picks up two Leis from a box behind the counter. He Robbie walk over to AMY and KATIE who are standing over n the buffet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to ROBBIE, but if front of AMY and Katie) Now this will never do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (agreeing) I'm afraid you're right.     Something must

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Page 42 of 81 be done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALEX and ROBBIE set the smoothies on a nearby table. They remove the cheap plastic Leis the girls are wearing. Then they put on the real ones they carried over. ALEX steps b to admire his work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yes,    yes....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perfect.    A work of art.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls look at each other and smile. ALEX and ROBBIE g the smoothies and hand two to the girls. AMY sips hers ri away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't remember anything like this on Aokee's menu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting) ..special smoothies. Fortunately, you know people on the inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Onstage, the band had finished a tune before the dialog b above. Now JAFFA steps up to the mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'd like thank Aokee and his crew for hosting this evening's Luau.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone applauds, AOKEE waves. Alex raises a hand and wa off the accolade. ROBBIE nods and smiles as the AMY and KATIE clap as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'd also like to bring Aokee up to sing one of his Hawaiian specialties.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again, everyone claps and cheers him on.    AOKEE goes on stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You girls want to dance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grabbing ROBBIE's hand and leading out to the dance floor) Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AMY shrugs yes and goes out with ALEX.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (onstage)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Page 43 of 81 Mahalo and Aloha. This song is sung on my island for all young people in love...or about to be. Is called E O'Mai, or, You Are Mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AOKEE begins singing the Hawaiian love song, "E O'Mai". couples are dancing; it is a slow song. ALEX, of course, is a goof. He dances slow, but every onc in a while executes a deep dip, much to AMY's terror. EDDIE is off to the edge of the dance floor, watching, longingly, and kind of swaying to the music. A couple of girls walk by and he does a magic trick for them. He holds both hands up, palms open to show he has nothing his hands. He also gestures that he has no sleeves (he is wearing a tuxedo t-shirt). He reaches behind his back and pulls out a trick bouquet of flowers, but they don't quit open right, and are still unfolding as he holds them. EDDIE smiles weakly, he knows that isn't quite how it was supposed to go. The girls appear encouraging, but as they leave look at each other and giggle. We pick up ROBBIE and KATIE dancing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So. How are things working out at Aokee's?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, he's great. Alex too. I thought this summer was going to be a train wreck, but it's not turning out too bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, of course this isn't California...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, but it looks like I will get a chance to do some surfing anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Apparently there's some kind of surfing contest and Aokee is all over me to enter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean the Surfer King?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've heard of it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all the other girls seem to talk about. This is my first year, but

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Page 44 of 81 apparently it's a pretty big deal. Being from Oceanside, you should have a good chance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll see. It seems kind of stupid to me. A surfing contest in Colorado. (laughing) My friends back home would never believe it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They continue to dance. WE SEE BIG MIKE talking to TIFFAN and gesturing broadly. TIFFANY is clearly not agreeing wi what he is saying. COWBOY is nowhere to be seen. Suddenly throws up her hands and marches over to the dance floor w EDDIE is standing alone, swaying a bit to the music. She whispers something in his ear, and EDDIE'S eyes get r big as she leads him by the hand to the middle of the dan floor. She wraps her arms around EDDIE and they dance, al the while glaring at her father. EDDIE knows a good thing when he sees it, and quickly set in, Big Man on Campus. TIFFANY is taller than he is, so h happily puts his head on HER shoulder. BIG MIKE looks back at them, not happy with the way it happened, but satisfied. DOUG FITZGERALD (twenty bucks DOUG) is dancing with a gir when ALEX, doing some kind of fancy spin to AMY, bumps in him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to ALEX) Alex. Got my twenty bucks?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Dougie. You know, I left my wallet over in my locker. I'll see you before we leave and get it to you then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, you could always come by Aokee's and I could give it to you in trade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cash money, Alex.   Cash money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALEX grabs AMY and swings her into another fancy move tha leads them away from DOUG. Page 45 of 81 The song ends, and everybody claps.     AOKEE bows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to KATIE) Hey, listen. Alex told me about this great spot on the other side of Thunder Bay that looks down on the party, but it's a little more quiet. Want to go for a walk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They pick up their smoothies and walk off into the night.

dialogues.speaker: EXT MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: ROBBIE is walking on the seawall that separates the bay f the sunning area, tightrope style. KATIE walks next to hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So...what made your folks pick up from beautiful southern California and move to Colorado?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not both my folks.   Just my Mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aha...trouble in paradise?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's just say my father had an eye for his administrative assistant, and now they're both somewhere in Mexico. Mom got a job here, some of her family's here, so they said "Colorady is the place you outta be".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It could be worse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I must admit, I've met some very nice people. (looking down and smiling) In California, the attitude's a little different. Here, not everyone is out to prove something. Seem's like everyone just wants to have fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a theory. Sometimes it snows here so hard, that it's a challenge just to get to work or to school. Everything shuts down for a day or so. If your car gets stuck, people appear from nowhere to help pull you out and get you back on the road. Most people here don't just look out for themselves. A lot of times,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Page 46 of 81 they're looking out for you, too.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: ALEX and AMY are inside the KIOSK.    ALEX is showing her everything works.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All these switches feed sound throughout the park. Which reminds me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls out a CD and pops it into the CD Player and pres PLAY. He sees a flyswatter and begins waving it around li a sword.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And this is for bad little girls who don't know how to have fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He begins swishing it around, AMY is giggling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oops.   There....almost got you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AMY is dodging and laughing. ALEX closes in and seems lik he will kiss her, but just starts gumming her neck, tickl her. AMY leans back laughing and WE SEE her back hits the volume knob on the amplifier.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. NIGHT
dialogues.text: They have reached   the area to the west of Thunder Bay. simply a concrete   pad that overlooks the party below. W hear "Paradise is   in Your Eyes" by Michael Peace, which begins with a lot   of jungle sound effects.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking down at the party) You were right. This is nice. (reacting to the jungle noises) But not necessarily quieter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a sec.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks away slightly and gets on the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Alex. Give us break down here. Turn down the sound effects.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. NIGHT
dialogues.text: ALEX and AMY are kissing; she is up on the counter of the KIOSK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting, but to AMY) Uh oh. Sorry. Hold that thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Page 47 of 81 He grabs the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into the radio) I'm on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
