dialogues.text: He turns down the volume back to normal. He also flips a switch. They hear the tune now, and AMY jumps off the counter, stands there and smiles. ALEX does an over-the-t mambo moving to her and they start to slow dance.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. NIGHT
dialogues.text: ROBBIE has set down the radio, and is walking back to KAT now, who is swaying to the music. He doesn't get too clos to her, and actually stands off to her left. Since she has the room and is momentarily inspired, she begins a few dance moves, ballet, and then ballroom style ROBBIE has seen this sort of thing before, and instinctiv almost without thinking steps in and becomes her dance partner. They proceed in a beautiful dance that almost se rehearsed. Finally it occurs to them both.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quizzically) So where did you learn to dance like this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) Eight years at Miss Vickie's Studio of Dance. What surprises me is you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (somewhat embarrassed, keeps dancing) Can you keep my deepest, darkest secret?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hesitantly) When you grow up within spitting distance of Hollywood, every mother seems to think her child is the next Harrison Ford. So when I was about 12, my Mom started taking me to all these auditions for things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So are you the next Harrison Ford?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some days I'm not even the next Robbie Zirpollo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They continue to dance.    After a few moments... Page 48 of 81

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stop and walk over to the railing overlooking the pa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turns out I get this part. They're selling some dish soap or something, and they think it will be magical to have two twelve year old kids dancing ballroom on this fantasy set with clouds and everything. They lock this girl and I into a dance studio with a choreographer for two weeks, and then they shoot the commercial.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't sound so terrible.     You certainly learned how to dance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but when it came out everyone in school saw it. I couldn't go anywhere for six months without everyone in the room laughing their heads off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (touched, drawing closer) I'm not laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They kiss, then return to dancing.

dialogues.speaker: SHACK
dialogues.text: WE SEE ALEX and ROBBIE discussing something; forming a pl They are going to look for Pipeman. ALEX gestures in one direction, and ROBBIE takes off. ALEX goes in another.

dialogues.speaker: FUNHOUSE
dialogues.text: ALEX walks up to the Guard, appears to ask a question. guard shakes his head "no". ALEX walks off.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. MORNING
dialogues.text: ROBBIE is talking to a cashier in the store.     She shak head 'no'. Robbie walks out hurriedly.

dialogues.speaker: MUSIC BED
dialogues.text: ALEX is talking to Jaffa. JAFFA gestures wildly, as if telling some big mythical story, but at the end throws up hands as if to say, "I don't know". Page 49 of 81

dialogues.speaker: SURF MUSIC BED
dialogues.text: We are in pitch darkness. We hear the sound of heavy scraping metal. Lights shine and we are looking up throug manhole cover being removed. ROBBIE bends over the hole a hollers "PIPEMAN" and peers in. He shakes his head negatively and moves on.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. MORNING
dialogues.text: We are at the back door to Big Mike's. ALEX knocks, and t same kid as before, DAVE, pops his head out. ALEX appears ask a question, DAVE goes back in as ALEX waits. DAVE com out again and gestures, "no one knows". ALEX starts to le but turns back and asks something else. DAVE disappears a comes back with a burger. ALEX shrugs, and walks away unwrapping and eating the burger.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. MORNING
dialogues.text: ROBBIE sees a door marked, "EMPLOYEES ONLY". He looks dow at his employee ID and shrugs and goes in. As he enters w see he is pushed out by some unknown force. Out the open door comes "Wally" the Water World mascot, who walks off. Robbie has been knocked to the ground and looks up, shaki his head. He gets up and walks off.

dialogues.speaker: MUSIC BED
dialogues.text: Now it is ALEX who has separately come upon the same door not knowing ROBBIE has already been there. He enters, and the door remains open. We hear girls screaming and he exi quickly, followed by a volley of thrown girl's underwear, swimsuits and towels.

dialogues.speaker: MUSIC BED
dialogues.text: This room is creepy. It is full of loud pumps and large pipes. ROBBIE is making his way through a labyrinth of piping and gauges and the like. He peers and sees a head with a red scarf, but it moves out of view.  Surf music fades. There is a constant whine of the pumps. ROBBIE moves furt in and finally comes across a man holding a large pipewre with his back to him. He is working to tame a small leak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No reaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (loudly this time) Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Page 50 of 81 This startles and kind of angers PIPEMAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.   You're not supposed to be in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, sorry. Are you Pipeman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (recovering from the startle) Not on purpose. I guess some people call me Pipeman. 'Spose it's better than Carl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're real name's Carl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I just said Pipeman was a better name than Carl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Well, my name's Robbie.      I work at Aokee's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. OK.   What the hell you doin' down here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need your help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That scrubsink at Aokee's leakin' again? Gees, I knew we shoudda replaced...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not the scrub sink. I need your help. I'm competing in the Employee Olympics. With your advanced surfing experience, Aokee thought you might be able to help me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself) Everybody wants to be the Surfer King. (to ROBBIE) What advanced surfing experience?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you know. "Pipeman"? Hawaii's North Shore? Surfing the pipeline?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ohhh. Bad news, kid. I hate to disappoint you, but this is the reason they call me Pipeman. I'm the plumber around here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PIPEMAN holds up the large wrench. Page 51 of 81

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, boy. See, I'm from California, and I can surf, I just don't know what to expect from the wave on Thunder Bay. I...I was just hoping you could help, I really am sorry for bothering you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROBBIE begins walking out, dejected.    PIPEMAN looks at and feels sorry for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute, kid. I do know a little about surfing. I also know a lot about the wave here. What exactly are you looking for from me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (perking up) I need a mentor; you know like in Karate Kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karate Kid. He works at Big Mike's doesn't he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no it's a movie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never seen it. Don't know much about this mentor thing. How's it work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Generally, you, as mentor, draw on some personal religious philosophy to first intimidate, and then later inspire me. What religion are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (proudly) I'm Norman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, Brigham Young and all that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no NNNNORM-AN. We follow the big fat guy on Cheers reruns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay...and your belief structure....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Usually involves a lot of beer and corn nuts, but I don't think that's gonna work here. (thinking) Tell you what. Meet me at Thunder Bay tomorrow morning,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Page 52 of 81 eight a.m., bring your board and we'll work something out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (happily) Great, perfect. Thanks. I won't let you down. (walking away, muttering to himself) What the heck is a corn-nut?

dialogues.speaker: EXT. MORNING
dialogues.text: WE SEE Thunder Bay looking east. AOKEE and ALEX are setti up lawn chairs. AOKEE is lathering on suntan lotion, and puts on a large straw hat. ALEX puts sun block cream on h nose, and they both sit on the lawn chairs. They both hav large smoothies. ROBBIE appears with his surfboard, and lays it up against east fence at Thunder Bay. PIPEMAN arrives carrying a sma device in a plastic ziplock bag. ROBBIE approaches PIPEMAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi!  Glad you could make it. (pointing to PIPEMAN's hand) What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is how I trigger the wave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With that?     A garage door clicker?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you think? Waves just happen? This is Colorado, kid. Now get your board and get in the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robbie gets his board and jumps into Thunder Bay, paddlin over to the narrow side where the wave begins. PIPEMAN goes down the stairs leading to near where ROBBIE positioned himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure that's where you want to be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should be about right. Aren't you getting in? Where's your board?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mentors don't get wet. I looked it up. (pressing the clicker) Get ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wave comes and ROBBIE begins paddling.     He misses it Page 53 of 81 splashes the water angrily and turns back to paddle to position again. AOKEE and ALEX look at each other nervous

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want to know what you did wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mad) Just gimme another wave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oakey doakey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another wave comes. ROBBIE paddles furiously and misses i again. Now he's really angry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tersely) Okay. Please. Tell me what I did wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're in the wrong position. The wave doesn't crest that soon. Move ten feet further away from the back wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself) The ocean never had a back wall. (to Pipeman) Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROBBIE paddles over to the spot suggested by PIPEMAN. AOK and ALEX are now sitting on the edge of the lawn chairs anxiously awaiting the next wave. It comes and ROBBIE catches it easily and begins riding it aggressively. He h a good run and kicks out at the end. AOKEE and ALEX high-five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (together) Yeee-haww.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They settle back into their chairs to absorb some sun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AOKEE is behind the counter finishing up making a smoothi RICHARD, head lifeguard is on the other side; he will get smoothie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grinning) So. I hear he's pretty good.     Haven't seen him myself yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (concerned, covering) Good? Good at what? Who you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Page 54 of 81

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. Your ringer from California. Everyone says he's gonna give Cowboy a run for his money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robbie?    Robbie barely walk without help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear a loud CRASH from the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gees!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AOKEE gestures back towards the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your Surfer King. We just make a good show. Your boy have nothing to worry about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know I'd feel a lot better if you hadn't taken most of my money in that poker game last Friday night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dismissive) Poker? Not an island game.     I no good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods) Right. Tell you what. Sight unseen even money, twenty dollars on Cowboy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to bet with me? Take my twenty dollars, just like that? Humph. Not worth the trouble, twenty dollars. Now, maybe a hundred...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hundred bucks...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANOTHER CRASH from the kitchen, this time pots & pans

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to kitchen) Robbie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK, a hundred bucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They slap hands to seal the deal.    RICHARD leaves, grin and shaking his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to kitchen)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Page 55 of 81 Robbie?   That you?   Come out here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (entering from kitchen) Sorry, dude, that tray was way off balance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robbie, our secret getting out.     You practice too good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (happy) I'm really getting the hang of that wave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fall more.     Make good show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinking) I'll try to remember to look and see who's watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pours the rest of RICHARD's smoothie) Good. Here, have a smoothie. You too skinny to surf good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROBBIE smiles and takes the smoothie back to the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: EXT EARLY MORNING.
dialogues.text: ROBBIE and PIPEMAN are in the middle of a practice sessio PIPEMAN is at the side, ROBBIE is in the water on his boa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gesturing) OK, now this time, get up on the board more quickly. This is a wave pool and this wave dissipates quickly. You only have a little time to show your stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How will the judging work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You get a possible ten points. Three for your surfing, three for your style and four for the judge's overall impression of your ride. No one's ever gotten a ten...I'm not really sure why.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've seen the competition.     What does everybody do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody just surfs, man and tries not to fall. The big reason Cowboy's done so

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Page 56 of 81 well is he goes to Hawaii for a couple weeks every year. But there he's mostly a longboarder. Your job is to figure out how to make the most outta this little wave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK.   I'm ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wave comes and ROBBIE catches it and surfs it hard, kicking up high at the end.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. MORNING
dialogues.text: WE SEE COWBOY and TIFFANY standing overlooking Thunder Ba COWBOY has binoculars and is looking through them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's pretty good, I'll give him that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (concerned) How good?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I have an off day, he could win.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (really concerned) That's terrible. You're the Surfer King.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, some days you get the wave, and some days the wave gets you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This can't happen.   What are we gonna do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what you're going to do, but as me for me, I'm gonna schedule some practice time of my own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This may take a lot more than extra practice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I don't know what else you expect. I'll go out and do my best. If that's not enough, it's not enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIFFANY grabs the binoculars and stares down at Thunder B WE SEE gears turning in her head.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. MORNING
dialogues.text: ROBBIE and Alex are walking by.   JAFFA sees them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Page 57 of 81 Hey, surfer boy! I got fifty bucks at three to one! Don't let me down, mon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to JAFFA) Hey Jaffa. NO worries. (to ALEX, shocked) People are betting on me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a little friendly pool. No big deal. Helps make this more interesting. Concessions never had a chance before...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've seen this Cowboy practice. His style is more longboard, and this is a shortboard wave, but he's still pretty good. I could lose you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two concessions girls are walking by them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (together) Hi Robbie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How ya doin' (to Alex after they have gone by) See. How come everyone knows me by sight now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, you're the next big thing. You'll survive it. The Employee Olympics are only a week away. What happens is we have this big opening ceremony where each team chooses a theme and we're judged on our spirit. Then different teams compete in contests that test their Water World skills. The next morning it all ends with the surf contest. You ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another group of concession girls calls ROBBIE from one o the snack bars. He waves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I suppose. I've been working out a strategy to use if Cowboy has a real good day. It's risky...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then they both nearly run headlong into TIFFANY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, hello Robbie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised) You know me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Page 58 of 81

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course I know you. It's my father's park, I try get to know everyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting, eager) I'm Alex!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I'm sure you are. (ignoring ALEX, back to Robbie) It's been a while since I've been to Aokee's. Do you suppose if I come down in a little while you could make some of that special chicken, what is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The best teriyaki east of the Pacific.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes...and one those smoothies I hear so much about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stunned) Well, sure. I'll be working all afternoon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a date then.    See you later!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks off. ROBBIE just stands there. ALEX starts walking, then comes back. Finally ALEX pushes him on the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, we gotta get back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still shocked) Yes. Yes we do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AOKEE is wiping the counter alone.    HE turns toward the kitchen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex! We need more large smoothie cups out here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AOKEE continues cleaning up. ALEX shows up with a load of cups, AOKEE takes them and starts placing then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to ALEX) Look at that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE SEE in a far corner of AOKEE's TIFFANY and ROBBIE in a Page 59 of 81 animated, engaging conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Second time this week. Our boy Big Man on Campus, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big something. I hope he knows how to work without a net.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well. We all grow up sometime. He not drop a tray of dishes in days. Something going right.   You think he ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess we'll both find out on Sunday.     I sure hope so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE SEE TIFFANY and ROBBIE again, and TIFFANY is laughing loudly at some joke ROBBIE has made.

dialogues.speaker: EXT NEAR SUNSET
dialogues.text: ROBBIE, ALEX, AMY and KATIE are clocking out for the day. ROBBIE clocks out first. TIFFANY drives up in her convertible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (waving him over) Robbie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROBBIE goes over to talk to her.    WE SEE him go around passenger side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting) Alex! I won't need a ride tonight after all. Tiff's taking me home!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROBBIE jumps in and they drive away. ALEX, AMY and KATIE still standing on the porch of the TIME SHACK, shocked at what they've seen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disbelief) Tiff?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grossed out) Tiff?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (forlorn, stunned) Tiff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE SEE ROBBIE and TIFFANY drive out the gate.     We see walk slowly out of the park alone. As she is walking, we flash back to scenes of KATIE and Page 60 of 81 ROBBIE together, dancing and laughing. This time the danc moves to the song of Allison Krause's "New Favorite". We take a final look at KATIE with the setting sun at her back and see she is crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the rising sun behind AOKEE's head as he raises a conch shell and blows it like a horn. He is dressed like Hawaiian prince. As the shot widens it reveals six males and two females dressed in Hawaiian native garb. ROBBIE And ALEX are amon several drummers with bamboos sticks in their hands that provide percussion for the Hawaiian war dance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aie, noka moka kei kai ke alo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The drums begin and the male dancers, carrying spears beg the Hawaiian war dance. The drummers sing the Hawaiian fo tune "No ka moku Kiakahi Ke Aloha". There are about 100 concessions kids in regular uniform sitting cross-legged behind them, clapping the beat in unison. The MALE DANCERS circle each other in time to the beat, gesturing a story the seems to involve some invading army The war dance progresses until the invading warriors are defeated and the folk song ends. At the end, the kids sitting behind raise their hand and shout.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Concessions! Concessions! Concessions!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking to the south side of the pool, we see about 50 grounds kids sitting in rows. In our foreground there are six large trash cans, with toilet plungers arranged next them, 2 each. To our left are a line of six grounds kids in army fatigu carrying brooms as if rifles. The lead kid shouts:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Company!   Forward, march.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE DRILL team marches into full view. The grounds kids behind clap the march beat. The marchers stop in front of the line of trash cans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Company!   Halt!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Present Arms!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Page 61 of 81 The brooms come off their shoulders and are held forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Company!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Order arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They begin a routine practiced with brooms, in a cadence, clapped by the grounds kids behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you do if it's wet and not yours?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in cadence) Don't touch it! Don't touch it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you deal with a full can of trash?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We empty!     We empty!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sound off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trash Rats!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trash Rats!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sound off, Trash Rats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trash rats! Trash Rats!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stop.     Their brooms are raised over their heads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Company!     Brooms Ho!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They allow their brooms to fall to their right side and m to the trash cans. They pull out bright blue ski masks, a BLUE MAN GROUP, and pick up the toilet plungers. The lead marcher holds his plunger high and shouts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Company!     Begin!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He counts a four beat rhythm and they begin a BLUE MAN/ST like drum routine with the trash cans. Page 62 of 81 Two grounds kids in regular grounds uniforms approach hol steel trash can lids by the handles (with gloves). These become drums as well as two of the drummers switch from t can to can lids using the stick side of the toilet plunge the drumstick. A competition erupts from the left and right sides of the line as they each set a beat and then the other matches. Finally, a show of unity as both sides join back into the beat for an ending flourish. They pick up their brooms and turn their attention to the kids behind them. They begin to march in place and the se grounds kids clap for the tempo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the seated GROUNDS KIDS) What do you do when the table's a mess?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (together) We wipe it! We wipe it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you do when a toilet's stopped up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We plunge it! We plunge it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sound off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trash rats!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sound off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trash rats!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sound off trash rats!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trash rats! Trash rats!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They clap and cheer, and settle back down to sit. All is quiet now. WE SEE concessions kids sitting, ground kids sitting and we look to the west side of the pool and lifeguards sitting. Everyone is looking around. Suddenly two lifeguards dressed as Roman Soldiers appear horns. They bellow a Roman Call to Action, and two Roman drummers lead a column of other lifeguards. Page 63 of 81 First we see female guards dressed in togas filing in. Be them are six gladiators with swords and shields, marching They are followed by one female lifeguard with a basket o rose petals. She is throwing them into the path of the ne group to enter. Next we see six more guards dressed as slaves carrying COWBOY, who is sitting up on a First Aid backboard. HE is wearing laurel leaves and a toga, he is obviously Cesar. the backboard is also the surfer king trophy. They all approach the area in front of the seated guards, rearrange themselves so that COWBOY has a good view of th gladiators. The drummers count a cadence that sets the pa for a simulated battle between the gladiators. The simulated battle rages until three of the gladiators on their knees before the three victorious gladiators. Th victorious gladiators hold their swords over the fallen o and look to COWBOY for a yea or nay. COWBOY generously waves and makes a thumbs up signal, and swords are put away. The seated lifeguards all raise thei fists and shout.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (together) Lifeguards! Lifeguards!     Lifeguards!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guards holding COWBOY set him down in front of an elevated platform that has a microphone.. COWBOY picks up the surfer king trophy and walks to the platform. He sets the trophy on a table next to the microphone, arranging it carefully. We see now there is a large banner hanging at the back of wave pool that says "WATER WORLD WELCOMES EMPLOYEE OLYMPIANS". COWBOY moves to the microphone and raises his arm in a re manner and speaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to all) Let the games...begin!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The seated crowd now stands and cheers loudly. We see a group of three people, two male and one female, adults we will later identify as JUDGES. They nod approvingly and write something down on their clipboards. We see BIG MIKE near them, smiling broadly.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. LATER THAT DAY
dialogues.text: We see that the lounge chairs have been removed and the a is clear. There are scattered squashed up pieces of white paper lying about. Page 64 of 81 We look to the south and see that there are three boy/gir teams with one of their legs tied together, like a three legged race. The rub here is one team member has the dustpan and the o team member has the broom. A JUDGE triggers a starter pis and they are off. The lifeguard team falls almost immediately, and the grou team takes a early lead over the concessions team, who ar trying to figure the dustpan/broom operation out. The two grounds people work tightly together and quickly advance. The lifeguards have gotten back up and are hobbling up to their first piece of trash. Concessions has figured out t dustpan, but are still well behind the grounds kids. Finally, the grounds kids win, with concessions up second and lifeguards trailing in third. The judges note the fin on their clipboards.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. LATER THAT DAY
dialogues.text: We see three male participants standing in the shallow en Thunder Bay, One red suit (lifeguard) one blue suit (concessions) and one green suit (grounds) A JUDGE on the rise to the west of Thunder Bay blows an a horn to start the race. They all rush into the bay and be swimming furiously. The guard takes the lead quickly, followed not far behind the grounds kid. The concessions kid is working hard and splashing a lot but not getting very far. As the guard reaches the back wall, he does an underwater racing turn and swims back toward the point where they started. Right behind him, the smaller grounds kid does t same thing. As they are returning, they pass the concessions kid, who still is splashing a lot but not going fast. After they p him he stops, as he is tired out. Momentarily he can't even tread water any more, and a gua watching from the sidelines jumps in and pulls him out. T swimming guard has beaten the grounds kid, the concession kid never finishes.

dialogues.speaker: EXT LATER THAT DAY
dialogues.text: There are three lines set up with several participants. I is a relay race, with the baton replaced by a tray full o drinks in paper cups, water. The colors indicate again concessions, guards and grounds. The race is already in full swing, with concessions in th lead. The last group of relayers are now getting their trays, and concessions is way ahead. Page 65 of 81 Everyone is cheering their team on. The final pass is mad to SARAH who works for AOKEE's. She takes the tray and mo gracefully to the final stop. There is a small table on which the drinks must be placed. She is clearly going to win when she suddenly stops. All concessions kids are shocked and plead her to go on. She does a nifty and graceful around the back maneuver wi the tray, proceeds to the table, and sets down the drinks tipping the tray sideways to show no water has been spill The JUDGES scribble furiously. 62        EXT. LATER THAT DAY - AOKEE'S SURF & SNACK Three picnic tables are set up in front of AOKEE's. WE do past each one to see that they are cluttered indentically with what appears to be the leftovers from lunch for four Behind each table is a team of two guards, concessions an grounds kids. A JUDGE blows a whistle and we begin by looking at the lifeguard team. It is a boy and a girl and the girl is not too keen on th They bring a trash can with them and begin gingerly clear the table, acting as if they are afraid to get their hand dirty. We dolly left to see the concessions team a little ahead the guard team. We dolly further left to reveal a grounds kid in a full r suit with a face shield. A tremendous force of water is clearing the table into th trash can which the rain-suited grounds kid is holding at it's end. We dolly further left to see EDDIE in full army fatigues safety goggles on and wearing the biggest super-soaker wa gun in the history of man. The table is quickly cleared, and at the same time washed EDDIE holds up the business end of the Super-Soaker gun a blows imaginary smoke from it's barrel, like an old Weste gunfighter. The JUDGES take notes.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. LATER THAT DAY
dialogues.text: The three different teams are gathered in groups waiting the next challenge. One of each team is in full sweats, color coordinated by team. ALEX is the one in the sweats for concessions. Slowly the sweats people walk into the pool about waist deep and lay Page 66 of 81 down. The grounds kid is the littlest guy of all. A JUDGE blows a whistle and four members of each team run into the water and drag their now soaked sweat suited teammate out of the water. They lie them down on a clear area and begin CPR. The guards have a nifty little plastic device that lets t blow air into the mouth of their victim, and they roll hi quickly on his side to clear water and back to begin CPR. They are fast and efficient, and clearly expertly trained We move left to see the grounds kids, knowledgeable but inexperienced. One girl is using her hands to provide a seals over the mouth of her "victim" and another is clums pumping his chest while the others try to keep a count wh reading some kind of instruction card.. We move again to see the concessions kids, who are in trouble. ALEX is lying there dying, and they are arguing about who has to breathe into his mouth. They form a circ over him, pointing and arguing. Finally they all just walk off and ALEX is still lying on ground, eyes rolled back and twitching convulsively in a hilarious death scene. The JUDGES take their notes.

dialogues.speaker: EXT LATER THAT DAY
dialogues.text: Once again three teams representing the three competing factions. Large stainless steel pots are bubbling on thre propane cooking stands in front of the concession. The teams each have three members in cooking aprons, agai color coded. One from each team is stirring the team's ch while the others watch the JUDGES anxiously. Lines are forming in front of each pot, with people in li each carrying a paper chili bowl, but holding back, defer to the JUDGES. The JUDGES are each carrying three styro c in which to receive the chili. They each get a portion from the guard team and take a si They smile politely to the cooks, but turn around and spi the chili back into the cup as delicately as possible, al as if throwing up. A concessions kid is there with a tray waters, which they quickly take advantage of. They move on to the grounds team. They get their portions and taste the chili and nod, not bad. They take another sip of water to clear their palate and on to the concessions team. The portions are proudly scooped. They take a taste, smile and take some more.     They hud Page 67 of 81 a moment and then place a blue ribbon on the concessions The lines quickly rearrange and merge themselves so that everyone is in line for the concessions pot.

dialogues.speaker: EXT LATER THAT DAY
dialogues.text: An obstacle course has been set up, and the event provide background to the dialogue that follows. AOKEE has some papers, and is talking to ALEX and ROBBIE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking through the papers) This isn't good. (looking at ALEX and ROBBIE) It's the same as every year. Pretty much a dead heat going into the surf championship tomorrow morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe those guys screwed up the CPR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hard to blame them. No one told them they had to put their mouth on yours until the last minute. Yuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bunch of babies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to ROBBIE) It's going to be up to you. We slip a little. You have to make up. That trophy need a new home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look over at the obstacle course where a tiny ground kid is jumping up and down and raising his arms ROCKY-sty

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need to make up. You ready? Tomorrow morning last event. You our last hope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROBBIE just looks at both of them nods and sighs heavily the other grounds kids surround our winner in the backgro AOKEE and ALEX walk off. Suddenly TIFFANY appears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi Robbie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shy but still very much smitten) Oh. Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's your team doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh.   OK, I guess.      Kind of a tie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Page 68 of 81

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I think you're going to take care of that tomorrow morning. In fact, I've planned a little celebration in advance. We're going to this incredible party up in the foothills at some friends of mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (intrigued) Party, huh? That sounds like fun.       I have to work until nine tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's perfect. I'll come back here and pick you up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She starts to walk off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, and Robbie...call your mom and tell her you're spending the night at Alex's or something. It's going to be a very special night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hypnotised) K...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks away. ROBBIE stands there a moment before wakin up and leaving also. 66        INT. EVENING - AOKEE'S SURF & SNACK SHACK It is dark. We see ALEX and AOKEE cleaning up from the da food service. ALEX Is wiping down the smoothie area, AOKE is sweeping on the other side of the counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (voice somewhat hushed) I'm telling you we need to talk him. Something's going on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking his head no) Robbie know the right thing to do.     He's a good boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So how about this? He tells me I've got to cover for him if his mother calls. He told her he's spending the night at my house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He say that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Tiffany's got something up her sleeve and Robbie's too messed up to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Page 69 of 81 notice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reflective) Spending the night at your house.      This very bad. Very bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He should be done with the dishes by now. Tell him we want to talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALEX disappears back into the kitchen. AOKEE goes to an empty table under the one light on in the dining area and sits down. ALEX comes back and ROBBIE follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. I'm done with the pots and pans. It's almost nine. Can I take off now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robbie, please, sit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROBBIE sits down.   So does ALEX.   Robbie looks at both gets suspicious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything OK?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what we gonna ask you.    What you plan tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Tiffany invited me to a little party up in the mountains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robbie, you athlete. Big day tomorrow. You need sleep, not party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's no big deal.   I'll be fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is big deal. Robbie. You good boy, smart, everybody like you, but....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Face it. Only one reason Tiffany interested in you. She want to make you so tired and so crazy you lose tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disbelief) Aw, come on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Page 70 of 81

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robbie. She's still going out with Cowboy. I saw them together at the movies two nights ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe she's just letting him down easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robbie...things...things are not always what they seem to be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In this case, she acts like she likes you when really she wants Cowboy to win.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naw. You guys are nuts.      She's not like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I know what to believe and what not to. I'm not that easily fooled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aokee?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking his head) Go ahead. Tell him. I trust him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK. Take Aokee for instance.      Gentle, genial Hawaiian guy, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. He's great. I love working here. Aokee, you've been real good to me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then let me introduce you properly. Robbie Zirpollo, meet Manuel Ramirez.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AOKEE'S head is down in his hands. Robbie looks stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Manuel's family snuck across the border ten years ago through Juarez, Mexico.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (accent gone) My father refused to work for a drug lord who ran our town. They tried to kill

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Page 71 of 81 him.     We barely got out with our lives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aokee?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (accent now Mexican) A name I picked up reading an obituary in the paper. I sent away to Hawaii and got his birth records and social security number. This way, I never have to worry about immigration. I spent weeks watching tapes of Hawaii Five-O just to get the accent right. "Book 'em Danno". Huh. What's that all about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Alex) And you knew?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALEX nods yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I burnt my hand on the grill one day and started swearing in Spanish...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting) And I said, boy, you speak Spanish like a native....uh oh. It's been our little secret. Now it's your secret, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at his watch) I need to think about all this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding) You do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sleep tonight. Sleep well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gets up, dazed) Right. Goodnight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROBBIE leaves.     ALEX and AOKEE just sit, looking at ea other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hundreds of people are gathering on bleachers to watch th surfing competition. A large highway construction type signboard has been erec and says "Grounds   93", "Concessions 93" and "Lifeguards 94". It is almost a festival atmosphere.     The JUDGES are st Page 72 of 81 in a group, conferring, near a table that has the control for the sign. The sign can be viewed easily from the bleachers. WE look over to the front of AOKEE's and see AOKEE and AL standing outside the restaurant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Alex) Have you seen him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are looking to the north towards the crowd, but ROBB appears behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking in the same direction) What you lookin' at?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We looking for you.        How you sleep?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I slept fine. (pause as AOKEE and ALEX wait) I decided I'm not my father. I don't run out on the people I care about just because some blond shakes her ta-ta's at me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (relieved) We go then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROBBIE picks up his board, and they begin walking toward bleachers. ALEX stops and turns suddenly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shook her ta-tas? No one said anything about shaking ta-tas. (reflectively) This puts a whole new light on things!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is in ROBBIE's way.        ROBBIE pushes him with his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get going!

dialogues.speaker: EXT. EARLY MORNING
dialogues.text: ROBBIE, COWBOY and MELINDA from grounds, who we met earli and was conned into the contest because she said she surf once on vacation, are all standing in front of the JUDGES One JUDGE explains the rules. Page 73 of 81

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking down at clipboard) Alright, here's the deal. You get three tries; three heats. We judge each run and only your high score counts. If you fall you get no score for the run. Your score will be added to the total for your team, and the winner gets the Surfer King Trophy. Any questions?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all shake their head no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then let's begin. Grounds is up first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MELINDA grabs her board and begins paddling out. The wave comes and it's all she can do to stay on her board. She struggles and falls at the end. She will clearly not be a factor. The big screen shows a 0 in a column after the grounds score. We look back to the bleachers to polite applause, but the COLONEL and the grounds kids are clearly disappointed. COWBOY is out there now, the wave comes and he catches it easily. He rides the wave gracefully and well, and kicks at the end. The big screen shows an 8 in the lifeguard ro The lifeguards and RICHARD are cheering now. ROBBIE is next. He catches the wave and rides it more aggressively than COWBOY, but nearly falls at the end of run. The big screen shows an 8. The concessions kids and AOKEE are very enthusiastic. They can see they have a cha with ROBBIE. PIPEMAN is watching from a far corner. MELINDA begins her second run. She is a little more confident this time, but still seems barely able to stand ride the wave. More polite applause, and the big screen shows a 5. COWBOY catches his wave, and tries to imitate ROBBIE'S mo aggressive style, but falls midway through the run. We he a large gasp from the crowd as this happens. The crowd applauds politely, and the guards are supportiv but disappointed. We see the JUDGES confer and the big sc shows a 0. ROBBIE gets his wave, and surfs it aggressively again, th time not nearly falling at all. The JUDGES nod approvingl and confer. The big screen shows a 9. The crowd goes wild especially the concessions kids. Melinda begins her final run. She does better than the pa two, but not significantly. The JUDGES confer and the scr shows a 5. The ground kids are very disappointed, they kn they are out of it now. THE COLONEL shakes MELINDA'S hand and thanks her for her efforts. Page 74 of 81 COWBOY gets his wave, and has clearly decided to go back his original style; he rides the wave gracefully, but tak no chances. He kicks out at the end with a wave and a smile. The guar applaud, hoping to make it seem better than it was, and t JUDGES confer and the screen shows an 8. ROBBIE snags his wave and rides it aggressively again, bu loses his balance momentarily. It costs him; the JUDGES confer and the screen shows a 7. The concessions kids applaud, and the point totals show "Grounds   98", "Concessions 102" and "Lifeguards 102". EVERYONE is confused, there has never been a tie before. JUDGES Are flipping through papers, and BIG MIKE steps up the microphone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (clearing his throat, flustered) It looks like we have a tie. This has never happened before, but I seem to remember we provided for this possibility in the rules. Hopefully our judges can help us figure out what to do!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The HEAD JUDGE is reading to the other JUDGES out loud, s his hand on one of the papers and comes up to the mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reading from the rules, "...in the event of a tie at the end of three heats in the surf competition, the teams who are tied will participate in a sudden-death surf off. Additional heats will be run until a winner can be declared." (looking up at the crowd) The "Sudden Death" heat will begin in five minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody cheers...they're going to see some more great surfing. The JUDGES signal COWBOY and ROBBIE to come over. The hea JUDGE takes a quarter out of his pocket and points to COW to call it. It lands and the JUDGE looks at it. HE points to ROBBIE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to go first or second?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be ready in five minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 70        EXT -MOMENTS LATER - AOKEE'S SURF & SNACK S Page 75 of 81 ROBBIE, ALEX, AOKEE and PIPEMAN have gathered in front of AOKEE's to strategize.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what you do?   Wait for him to go crazy and fall?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't want to win with him falling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could always go out and do your very best, take a lot of chances and maybe win this thing on merit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dismissive) Don't be silly. That only works in the movies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes his head) Actually, that's exactly what I'm thinking. It's the reason we're in a tie. I've been too conservative. I've got to do everything I can, or just forget about it. It's all or nothing. (pause) We gotta pull the fin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pull da fin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think you can hold it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (explaining) One time, these tourists from Japan on the beach at La Jolla offered me a hundred bucks to do a full spin at the top of the wave, and then slide down and cut back and do a full back flip. I pulled it off. A friend of mine had a tricks board with just a single fin and foot pockets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gotta pull the fin. What do we do about the foot pockets?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got duct tape?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PIPEMAN reaches into his tool belt and pulls out a roll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of plumber would I be if I didn't have duct tape? Water World

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Page 76 of 81 Platinum!   Where do you want them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They place the board on a table. ROBBIE pulls off two sma pieces of tape and places them on the board.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here and here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PIPEMAN gets his screw gun out of his tool belt and begin removing the two outer fins of the board. He then begins looping duct tap around the board to create two foot pock This provides a background to the dialog below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, help me understand.      What you do now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pipeman is taking the extra fins off my board. I only need one to make a deep cut back. He is also putting some pockets to slip my feet into so when I flip upside down, I don't lose the board.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flip upside down?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A back flip. You guys see it on snowboarders here all the time, I'm sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah, I'm sure I did that last winter. But not on purpose! Dude. You're either gonna win this thing or you're gonna die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quickly, eagerly) It would be better if you won.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, a tie is like kissing your sister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mock anger) You stay away from my sister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear an air horn blast.      They are ready to start.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to PIPEMAN) I'll need the biggest wave you can give me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (imitating Mr. Scott on Star

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Page 77 of 81 Trek) I'll give 'er all she's got, Cap'n!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands Robbie the board. ALEX heads back to the bleache area, PIPEMAN goes to the pumphouse in back of Thunder Ba AOKEE hangs back with ROBBIE and speaks to him alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dropping his Hawaiian accent) Robbie. When you do this, do this mostly for Robbie Zirpollo. But do it just a little bit for Manny Ramirez, eh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AOKEE smiles and pats him on the back.    Robbie nods. head for the bay.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. MORNING
dialogues.text: COWBOY is in the water paddling out to get his wave. It comes and he has apparently decided to stay with what has gotten him this far; a conservative style that keeps him looking good without falling. His ride is similar to the last one, but even more graceful and lyrical and he gets

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to ROBBIE) Looks like he's waiting for you to make a mistake. You sure you know what you're doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just making this up as I go along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Works for me! Go get 'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROBBIE appears on the seawall holding his board and looki out first at the bay, then at the crowd. His mom, CONNIE waves, and he smiles weakly. HE sees KATIE and she looks hopeful. She hasn't given up him completely. He smiles at her and gets into the water. He begins paddling. It seems to take forever for him to g out to the spot where he catches the wave, but he finally arrives. He sits there for a moment, collecting himself, then rais his hand to signal he is ready. The CONCESSIONS KIDS have started to chant, ROBBIE! ROBBI The guards are anxious, but even they can't help moving t the cadence of the chant. The wave comes and he catches it quickly, and slips his f into the duct tape pockets. He misses one pocket at first then gets it in. He rides it carefully and at the right moment slides up t Page 78 of 81 the top and executes a full 360 degree turn out of the wa On landing back on the downside of the wave, he slides do it quickly, and then turns around with a deep cut and hea straight into the wave. At the top he bounces and does a complete back flip in slow motion. We see the crowd also in slow motion. AOKEE Is covering h eyes, he can't watch. ALEX's face is contorted with disbelief. Various faces in the crowd are in open-mouthed disbelief. THE JUDGES are staring intently, focussed so a not to miss anything. ROBBIE lands the flip, and rides the rest of the wave. waves to the crowd, and kicks off, exhausted. The place goes nuts. No one here has ever seen anything l this before. AOKEE and ALEX run into the water and help h out. People are still cheering. COWBOY knows he's in trouble. THE JUDGES confer only momentarily and the score 10 appea and the word concessions starts flashing along with the w winner. COWBOY nods in agreement. TIFFANY says something to him, and he appears angry. only hear part of his response, something like:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disbelief) You did WHAT?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AOKEE and ALEX lead him up to the grandstand. COWBOY also makes his way up there, and we see him talking to BIG MIK BIG MIKE nods in agreement and COWBOY goes to the mike as crowd settles down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As last year's Surfer King, it's my privilege to present this year's trophy to the most amazing surfer on the water today. Robbie! Congratulations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COWBOY shakes ROBBIE's hand, and ROBBIE speaks at the mik

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding trophy) I just want to thank Aokee, Alex and Katie for all their support.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see KATIE clapping, crying.   AOKEE and ALEX are clapp and smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I have just one thing to say to everyone in concessions. WE DID IT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROBBIE holds the trophy high as everyone cheers. Page 79 of 81

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grounds kids are stacking chairs in preparation for final closing. Tarps are being thrown over everything and tied down. Awnings are being taken down.     Chairs and tables are b moved. We see JAFFA packing up his CD's into that cardboard box. also snaps the winter covers for the sound equipment into place.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: A banner hangs over the time shack, "Thanks for another g year". ALEX, ROBBIE, KATIE and AMY are clocking out for t final time this summer. They all stop and look around one final time.     Suddenl TIFFANY drives up in her convertible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another summer gone. How about it Robbie? You gonna guard next year?      They could use your help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all walk closer to her car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know...we have a pretty good time at AOKEE's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, that's what I hear. Maybe I should work there next summer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALEX, ROBBIE, KATIE and AMY all say these lines pretty mu at the same time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wouldn't like it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a bad idea...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you're such a good guard...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd be miserable...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you're right.    See you around...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EDDIE appears out of the time shack wearing his tuxedo t shirt. Page 80 of 81

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (almost singing) Tiffany!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks up to her driver's side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (feeling charitable, warmly) Hello, Eddie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EDDIE shows there is nothing in his hands, then reaches i the car and from behind TIFFANY's ear pulls a plastic Eas Egg out. He hands it to her, and she opens it. A beautifu butterfly flies out and away. She is momentarily entrance

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, that's one of the most beautiful things I've ever seen. (pause, thinking, what the heck) Hop in Eddie, let me give you a ride home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EDDIE waves his hand for HER to scoot over so he can driv She is surprised, but does, almost reflexively. He gets i and he looks at ALEX, ROBBIE, KATIE and AMY grinning broa as he pulls away. ALEX, ROBBIE, KATIE and AMY just watch in stunned silence EDDIE and TIFFANY drive off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (collecting himself) Well. Just another summer at Water World.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group begins walking toward the exit gate, as we go w and helicopter upward. They get smaller and smaller in th shot as we hear the conversation continue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know Katie, I really am sorry I was such a jerk this summer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll be going to the same high school. You'll have plenty of chances to make it up to me. Let's see, there's Homecoming, the Christmas Dance, Valentines Day...and of course, the prom...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna need to borrow twenty bucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Page 81 of 81

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We helicopter up for a final shot over the whole park.
